## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with an "x" -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have run `ruff check .` and resolved all issues
- [ ] I have run `black .` to format my code
- [ ] I have run `mypy` and resolved type issues

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested edge cases and error conditions
- [ ] I have verified backwards compatibility

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated the README if needed
- [ ] I have added docstrings to new functions/classes
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG (if applicable)

### Security

- [ ] My changes don't introduce security vulnerabilities
- [ ] I haven't committed sensitive data (API keys, passwords, etc.)
- [ ] I have reviewed the security implications of my changes

- [ ] I have documented the breaking changes
- [ ] I have provided a migration guide
